intro: Burtonia scabra, commonly known as the rough burtonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Burtonia scabra is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Its unique morphology makes it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
